<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">RIDGEWOOD ENERGY U FUND, LLC</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a name="sop"><!--Anchor--></a>UNAUDITED

FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">(in thousands, except per share data)</div>

<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z19bbb13d55ff4e81a461d7789c69765b" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 76%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;

</td>

</td>

WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

</div>
</td>

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The accompanying notes are an integral part of these unaudited 
condensed financial statements.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">3</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" href="#TableofContents">Table of 
Contents</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">RIDGEWOOD ENERGY U FUND, LLC</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a name="NOTES"><!--Anchor--></a>NOTES TO 
UNAUDITED CONDENSED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">1. Organization and Summary of Significant 
Accounting Policies</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Organization</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Ridgewood Energy U Fund, LLC (the &#8220;Fund&#8221;), a 
Delaware limited liability company, was formed on August 28, 2006 and operates 
pursuant to a limited liability company agreement (the &#8220;LLC 
Agreement&#8221;) dated as of October 1, 2006 by and among Ridgewood Energy 
Corporation (the &#8220;Manager&#8221;) and the shareholders of the Fund, which 
addresses matters such as the authority and voting rights of the Manager and 
shareholders, capitalization, transferability of membership interests, 
participation in costs and revenues, distribution of assets and dissolution and 
winding up. The Fund was organized to primarily acquire interests in oil and gas
properties located in the United States offshore waters of Texas, Louisiana and 
Alabama in the Gulf of Mexico.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Manager has direct and</font> exclusive 
control over the management of the Fund&#8217;s operations.&#160; With respect 
to project investments, the Manager locates potential projects, conducts due 
diligence, and negotiates and completes the transactions.&#160; The Manager
performs, or arranges for the performance of, the management, advisory and 
administrative services required for Fund operations.&#160; Such services 
include, without limitation, the administration of shareholder accounts, 
shareholder relations and the preparation, review and dissemination of tax and 
other financial information.&#160; In addition, the Manager provides office 
space, equipment and facilities and other services necessary for Fund 
operations.&#160; The Manager also engages and manages the contractual relations
with unaffiliated custodians, depositories, accountants, attorneys, broker-
dealers, corporate fiduciaries, insurers, banks and others as required.&#160; 
See Notes 2 and 3.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Basis of 
Presentation</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">These unaudited interim condensed financial statements have 
been prepared by the Fund&#8217;s management in accordance with accounting 
principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
(&#8220;GAAP&#8221;) and in the opinion of management, contain all adjustments 
(consisting of only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to present fairly 
the Fund&#8217;s financial position, results of operations and cash flows for 
the periods presented.&#160; Certain information and note disclosures normally 
included in annual financial statements prepared in accordance with GAAP have 
been omitted in these unaudited interim condensed financial statements.&#160; 
The results of operations, financial position, and cash flows for the periods 
presented herein are not necessarily indicative of future financial 
results.&#160; These unaudited interim condensed financial statements should be 
read in conjunction with the Fund&#8217;s December 31, 2015 financial statements
and notes thereto included in the Fund&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K filed 
with the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;).&#160; The year-
end condensed balance sheet data was derived from audited financial statements 
for the year ended December 31, 2015, but does not include all disclosures 
required by GAAP.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Use of
Estimates</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The preparation of financial statements in accordance with GAAP
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported 
amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and 
liabilities as of the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts 
of revenue and expense during the reporting period.&#160; On an ongoing basis, 
the Manager reviews its estimates, including those related to the fair value of 
financial instruments, net property balances, determination of proved reserves, 
impairment of long-lived assets and asset retirement obligations. Actual results
may differ from those estimates.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Fair Value 
Measurements</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The fair value measurement guidance provides a hierarchy that 
prioritizes and defines the types of inputs used to measure fair value. The fair
value hierarchy gives the highest priority to Level 1 inputs, which consists of 
unadjusted quoted prices for identical instruments in active markets. Level 2 
inputs consist of quoted prices for similar instruments.&#160; Level 3 inputs 
are unobservable inputs and include situations where there is little, if any, 
market activity for the instrument; hence, these inputs have the lowest 
priority.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Cash 
and Cash Equivalents</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All highly liquid investments with maturities, when purchased, 
of three months or less, are considered cash equivalents. These balances, as 
well as cash on hand, are included in &#8220;Cash and cash equivalents&#8221; on
the balance sheet. As of June 30, 2016, the Fund had no cash equivalents. At 
times, deposits may be in excess of federally insured limits, which are $250 
thousand per insured financial institution.&#160; As of June 30, 2016, the 
Fund&#8217;s bank balances were maintained in uninsured bank accounts at Wells 
Fargo Bank, N.A.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">4</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" href="#TableofContents">Table of 
Contents</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Salvage Fund</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund deposits in a separate interest-bearing account, or 
salvage fund, money to provide for the dismantling and removal of production 
platforms and facilities and plugging and abandoning its wells at the end of 
their useful lives in accordance with applicable federal and state laws and 
regulations.&#160; Interest earned on the account will become part of the 
salvage fund. There are no restrictions on withdrawals from the salvage 
fund.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Investment in Delta 
House</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund has investments in Delta House Oil and Gas Lateral, 
LLC and Delta House FPS, LLC (collectively &#8220;Delta House&#8221;), legal 
entities that own interests in a deepwater floating production system operated 
by LLOG Exploration Company.&#160; The Fund accounts for its investment in Delta
House using the cost method of accounting for investments as it does not have 
the ability to exercise significant influence over such investment.&#160; Under 
the cost method, the Fund recognizes an investment in the equity of an investee 
at cost.&#160;&#160; The Fund recognizes&#160;as income dividends received that 
are distributed from net accumulated earnings of the investee since the date of 
acquisition by the Fund.&#160; Dividends received in excess of earnings 
subsequent to the date of investment are considered a return of investment and 
are recorded as reductions of cost of the investment.&#160; The Fund reviews its
cost method investment for impairment at each reporting period and when an event
or change in circumstances has occurred that may have a significant adverse 
effect on the fair value of the investment.&#160; As of June 30, 2016, there are
no such events or changes in circumstances that indicate that the Fund&#8217;s 
investment in Delta House is impaired.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Oil 
and Gas Properties</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund invests in oil and gas properties, which are operated 
by unaffiliated entities that are responsible for drilling, administering and 
producing activities pursuant to the terms of the applicable operating 
agreements with working interest owners. The Fund&#8217;s portion of 
exploration, drilling, operating and capital equipment expenditures is billed by
operators.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Exploration, development and acquisition costs are accounted 
for using the successful efforts method. Costs of acquiring unproved and proved 
oil and natural gas leasehold acreage, including lease bonuses, brokers&#8217; 
fees and other related costs are capitalized. Costs of drilling and equipping 
productive wells and related production facilities are capitalized.&#160; The 
costs of exploratory wells are capitalized pending determination of whether 
proved reserves have been found. If proved commercial reserves are not found, 
exploratory well costs are expensed as dry-hole costs.&#160; At times, the Fund 
receives adjustments to certain wells from their respective operators upon 
review and audit of the wells&#8217; costs.&#160; Annual lease rentals and 
exploration expenses are expensed as incurred.&#160; All costs related to 
production activity, transportation expense and workover efforts are expensed as
incurred.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Once a well has been determined to be fully depleted or upon 
the sale, retirement or abandonment of a property, the cost and related 
accumulated depletion and amortization, if any, is eliminated from the property 
accounts, and the resultant gain or loss is recognized.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Advances to Operators 
for Working Interests and Expenditures</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund may be required to advance its share of the estimated 
succeeding month&#8217;s expenditures to the operator for its oil and gas 
properties.&#160; As the costs are incurred, the advances are reclassified to 
proved properties.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Asset 
Retirement Obligations</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For oil and gas properties, there are obligations to perform 
removal and remediation activities when the properties are retired.&#160; Upon 
the determination of a property to be either proved or dry, a retirement 
obligation is incurred.&#160; The Fund recognizes the fair value of a liability 
for an asset retirement obligation in the period incurred. Plug and abandonment 
costs associated with unsuccessful projects are expensed as dry-hole 
costs.&#160; As indicated above, the Fund maintains a salvage fund to provide 
for the funding of asset retirement obligations.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Syndication Costs</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Syndication costs are direct costs incurred by the Fund in 
connection with the offering of the Fund&#8217;s shares, including professional 
fees, selling expenses and administrative costs payable to the Manager, an 
affiliate of the Manager and unaffiliated broker-dealers, which are reflected on
the Fund&#8217;s balance sheet as a reduction of shareholders&#8217; 
capital.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Revenue Recognition and&#160;Imbalances</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Oil and gas revenues are recognized when oil and gas is sold to
a purchaser at a fixed or determinable price, when delivery has occurred and 
title has transferred, and collectability of the revenue is reasonably 
assured.<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font> The Fund uses the sales method of 
accounting for gas production imbalances.&#160; The volumes of gas sold may 
differ from the volumes to which the Fund is entitled based on its interests in 
the properties.&#160; These differences create imbalances that are recognized as
a liability only when the properties&#8217; estimated remaining reserves net to 
the Fund will not be sufficient to enable the underproduced owner to recoup its
entitled share through production.&#160; The Fund&#8217;s recorded liability, if
any, would be reflected in other liabilities.&#160; No receivables are recorded 
for those wells where the Fund has taken less than its share of 
production.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">5</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" href="#TableofContents">Table of 
Contents</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Impairment of Long-Lived Assets</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund reviews the carrying value of its oil and gas 
properties annually and when management determines that events and circumstances
indicate that the recorded carrying value of properties may not be 
recoverable.&#160; Impairments are determined by comparing estimated future net 
undiscounted cash flows to the carrying value at the time of the review.&#160; 
If the carrying value exceeds the estimated future net undiscounted cash flows, 
the carrying value of the asset is written down to fair value, which is 
determined using estimated future net discounted cash flows from the 
asset.&#160; The fair value determinations require considerable judgment and are
sensitive to change.&#160; Different pricing assumptions, reserve estimates or 
discount rates could result in a different calculated impairment.&#160; Given 
the volatility of oil and natural gas prices, it is reasonably possible that the
Fund&#8217;s estimate of discounted future net cash flows from proved oil and 
natural gas reserves could change in the near term.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Significant declines in oil and natural gas prices since fourth
quarter 2014 have impacted the fair value of the Fund&#8217;s oil and gas 
properties.&#160; If oil and natural gas prices continue to decline, even if 
only for a short period of time, it is possible that impairments of oil and gas 
properties will occur.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Depletion and
Amortization</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Depletion and amortization of the cost of proved oil and gas 
properties are calculated using the units-of-production method.&#160; Proved 
developed reserves are used as the base for depleting capitalized costs 
associated with successful exploratory well costs, development costs and related
facilities.&#160; The sum of proved developed and proved undeveloped reserves is
used as the base for depleting or amortizing leasehold acquisition costs.&#160; 
During the three and six months ended June 30, 2015, the Fund recorded $0.3 
million of depletion expense related to adjustments to asset retirement 
obligations for fully depleted properties.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Income Taxes</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">No provision is made for income taxes in the financial 
statements.&#160; The Fund is a limited liability company, and as such, the 
Fund&#8217;s income or loss is passed through and included in the tax returns of
the Fund&#8217;s shareholders. The Fund files U.S. Federal and State tax returns
and the 2013 through 2015 tax returns remain open for examination by tax 
authorities.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Income and Expense 
Allocation</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Profits and losses are allocated to shareholders and the 
Manager in accordance with the LLC Agreement.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Distributions</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Distributions to shareholders are allocated in proportion to 
the number of shares held. The Manager determines whether available cash from 
operations, as defined in the LLC Agreement, will be distributed.&#160; Such 
distributions are allocated 85% to the shareholders and 15% to the Manager, as 
required by the LLC Agreement.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Available cash from dispositions, as defined in the LLC 
Agreement, will be paid 99% to shareholders and 1% to the Manager until the 
shareholders have received total distributions equal to their capital 
contributions.&#160; After shareholders have received distributions equal to 
their capital contributions, 85% of available cash from dispositions will be 
distributed to shareholders and 15% to the Manager.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Recent Accounting 
Pronouncements</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In January 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board 
(&#8220;FASB&#8221;) issued accounting guidance that requires, among other 
things, companies to measure investments in other entities, except those 
accounted for under the equity method, at fair value and recognize any changes 
in fair value in net income unless an election is made to record the investment 
at cost, less impairment and plus or minus subsequent adjustments for observable
price changes with change in basis reported in current earnings. This 
pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2017 
and interim periods within those fiscal years, with early adoption not 
permitted. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance on its 
financial statements.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In 2014, the FASB issued accounting guidance on revenue 
recognition, which provides for a single five-step model to be applied to all 
revenue contracts with customers. In 2015, the FASB issued a deferral of the 
effective date of the guidance to 2018, with early adoption permitted in 2017. 
In May 2016, the FASB issued final amendments which provided narrow scope 
improvements and practical expedients related to the implementation of the 
guidance. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance on its 
financial statements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">6</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" href="#TableofContents">Table of 
Contents</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">2.&#160;&#160; Related Parties</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Pursuant to the terms of the LLC Agreement, the Manager renders
management, administrative and advisory services to the Fund.&#160; For such
services, the Manager is entitled to an annual management fee, payable monthly, 
of 2.5% of total capital contributions, net of cumulative dry-hole and related 
well costs incurred by the Fund.&#160; During 2012, the Manager elected to 
reduce its management fee to 1% annually. &#160;&#160;Management fees during the
three and six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 were $66 thousand and $0.1 
million, respectively.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Manager is entitled to receive a 15% interest in cash 
distributions from operations made by the Fund. Distributions paid to the 
Manager during the six months ended June 30, 2016 were $7 thousand. The Fund did
not pay distributions during the three months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 and 
during the six months ended June 30, 2015.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At times, short-term payables and receivables, which do not 
bear interest, arise from transactions with affiliates in the ordinary course of
business.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">None of the amounts paid to the Manager have been derived as a 
result of arm&#8217;s length negotiations.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund has working interest ownership in certain projects to 
acquire and develop oil and natural gas projects with other entities that are 
likewise managed by the Manager.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">3.&#160;&#160; Commitments and 
Contingencies</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Capital 
Commitments</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund has entered into multiple agreements for the 
acquisition, drilling and development of its oil and gas properties. The 
estimated capital expenditures associated with these agreements vary depending 
on the stage of development on a property-by-property basis.&#160; As of June 
30, 2016, the Fund&#8217;s estimated capital commitments related to its oil and 
gas properties were $5.8 million (which include asset retirement obligations for
the Fund&#8217;s projects of $2.5 million), of which $0.1 million is expected to
be spent during the next twelve months.&#160; These expected capital commitments
exceed available working capital and salvage fund by $3.3 million at June 30,
2016.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based upon its current cash position and its current reserve 
estimates, the Fund expects cash flow from operations to be sufficient to cover 
its commitments as well as ongoing operations. Reserve estimates are projections
based on engineering data that cannot be measured with precision, require 
substantial judgment, and are subject to frequent revision.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Environmental 
Considerations</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The exploration for and development of oil and natural gas 
involves the extraction, production and transportation of materials which, under
certain conditions, can be hazardous or cause environmental pollution 
problems.&#160; The Manager and operators of the Fund&#8217;s properties are 
continually taking action they believe appropriate to satisfy applicable 
federal, state and local environmental regulations and do not currently 
anticipate that compliance with federal, state and local environmental 
regulations will have a material adverse effect upon capital expenditures, 
results of operations or the competitive position of the Fund in the oil and gas
industry.&#160; However, due to the significant public and governmental interest
in environmental matters related to those activities, the Manager cannot predict
the effects of possible future legislation, rule changes, or governmental or 
private claims.&#160; As of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, there were no 
known environmental contingencies that required adjustment to, or disclosure in,
the Fund&#8217;s financial statements.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the past several years, the United States Congress, as 
well as certain regulatory agencies with jurisdiction over the Fund&#8217;s 
business, have considered or proposed legislation or regulation relating to the 
upstream oil and gas industry both onshore and offshore.&#160; If any such 
proposals were to be enacted or adopted they could potentially materially impact
the Fund&#8217;s operations.&#160; It is not possible at this time to predict 
whether such legislation or regulation, if proposed, will be adopted as 
initially written, if at all, or how legislation or new regulation that may be 
adopted would impact the Fund&#8217;s business. Any such future laws and 
regulations could result in increased compliance costs or additional operating 
restrictions, which could have a material adverse effect on the Fund&#8217;s 
operating results and cash flows.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Insurance 
Coverage</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund is subject to all risks inherent in the exploration 
for and development of oil and natural gas. Insurance coverage as is customary 
for entities engaged in similar operations is maintained, but losses may occur
from uninsurable risks or amounts in excess of existing insurance 
coverage.&#160; The occurrence of an event that is not insured or not fully 
insured could have a material adverse impact upon earnings and financial 
position.&#160; Moreover, insurance is obtained as a package covering all of the
funds managed by the Manager.&#160; Claims made by other funds managed by the 
Manager can reduce or eliminate insurance for the Fund.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">7</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a name="ITEM2"><!--Anchor--
></a>ITEM 
2.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">MANAGEMENT&#8217;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION 
AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Cautionary Statement Regarding Forward-
Looking Statements</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Certain statements in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q 
(&#8220;Quarterly Report&#8221;) and the documents Ridgewood Energy U Fund, LLC 
(the &#8220;Fund&#8221;) has incorporated by reference into this Quarterly 
Report, other than purely historical information, including estimates, 
projections, statements relating to the Fund&#8217;s business plans, strategies,
objectives and expected operating results, and the assumptions upon which those 
statements are based, are &#8220;forward-looking statements&#8221; within the 
meaning of the US Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 that are 
based on current expectations and assumptions and are subject to risks and 
uncertainties that may cause actual results to differ materially from the 
forward-looking statements. You are therefore cautioned against relying on any 
such forward-looking statements. Forward-looking statements can generally be 
identified by words such as &#8220;believe,&#8221; &#8220;project,&#8221; 
&#8220;expect,&#8221; &#8220;anticipate,&#8221; &#8220;estimate,&#8221;
&#8220;intend,&#8221; &#8220;strategy,&#8221; &#8220;plan,&#8221; 
&#8220;target,&#8221; &#8220;pursue,&#8221; &#8220;may,&#8221; 
&#8220;will,&#8221; &#8220;will likely result,&#8221; and similar expressions 
and references to future periods.&#160; Examples of events that could cause 
actual results to differ materially from historical results or those anticipated
include weather conditions, such as hurricanes, changes in market conditions 
affecting the pricing and production of oil and natural gas, the cost and 
availability of equipment, and changes in governmental regulations.&#160; 
Examples of forward-looking statements made herein include statements regarding 
projects, investments, insurance, capital expenditures and liquidity.&#160; 
Forward-looking statements made in this document speak only as of the date on 
which they are made.&#160; The Fund undertakes no obligation to update or revise
publicly any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information,
future events or otherwise, except as required by law.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Critical Accounting Policies and 
Estimates</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The discussion and analysis of the Fund&#8217;s financial 
condition and results of operations are based upon the Fund&#8217;s financial 
statements, which have been prepared in conformity with accounting principles 
generally accepted in the United States of America (&#8220;GAAP&#8221;).&#160; 
In preparing these financial statements, the Fund is required to make certain 
estimates, judgments and assumptions. These estimates, judgments and assumptions
affect the reported amounts of the Fund&#8217;s assets and liabilities, 
including the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities, at the date of 
the financial statements and the reported amounts of its revenues and expenses 
during the periods presented.&#160; The Fund evaluates these estimates and 
assumptions on an ongoing basis. The Fund bases its estimates and assumptions on
historical experience and on various other factors that the Fund believes to be 
reasonable at the time the estimates and assumptions are made. However, future 
events and actual results may differ from these estimates and assumptions and 
such differences may have a material impact on the results of operations, 
financial position or cash flows. See Note 1 of &#8220;Notes to Unaudited 
Condensed Financial Statements&#8221; &#8211; &#8220;Organization and Summary of
Significant Accounting Policies&#8221; contained in Item 1. &#8220;Financial 
Statements&#8221; within Part I of this Quarterly Report for a discussion of the
Fund&#8217;s significant accounting policies. No changes have been made to the 
Fund&#8217;s critical accounting policies and estimates disclosed in its 2015 
Annual Report on Form 10-K.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Overview of the Fund&#8217;s Business</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund is a Delaware limited liability company formed on 
August 28, 2006 to primarily acquire interests in oil and natural gas properties
located in the United States offshore waters of Texas, Louisiana and Alabama in 
the Gulf of Mexico.&#160; The Fund&#8217;s primary investment objective is to 
generate cash flow for distribution to its shareholders by generating returns
across a portfolio of exploratory or development oil and natural gas 
projects.&#160; Distributions to shareholders are made in accordance with the 
Fund&#8217;s limited liability company agreement (the &#8220;LLC 
Agreement&#8221;). The Fund does not expect in the future to investigate or 
invest in any additional projects other than those in which it currently has a 
working interest. The Fund&#8217;s remaining capital has been fully allocated to
complete such projects.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Ridgewood Energy Corporation (the &#8220;Manager&#8221; or 
&#8220;Ridgewood Energy&#8221;) is the Manager, and as such, has direct and 
exclusive control over the management of the Fund&#8217;s operations.&#160; The 
Manager performs or arranges for the performance of, the management, advisory 
and administrative services required for Fund&#8217;s operations.&#160; As 
compensation for its services, the Manager is entitled to an annual management 
fee, payable monthly, equal to 2.5% of the total capital contributions made by 
the Fund&#8217;s shareholders, net of cumulative dry-hole and related well costs
incurred by the Fund. &#160;During 2012, the Manager elected to reduce its 
management fee to 1% annually.&#160; The Fund does not currently, nor is there 
any plan to, operate any project in which the Fund participates.&#160; The 
Manager enters into operating agreements with third-party operators for the 
management of all exploration, development and producing operations, as 
appropriate.&#160; The Manager also participates in distributions.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">8</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" href="#TableofContents">Table of 
Contents</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Commodity Price 
Changes</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Changes in commodity prices may 
significantly affect liquidity and expected operating results.&#160; Reductions 
in oil and gas prices not only reduce revenues and profits, but could also 
reduce the quantities of reserves that are commercially recoverable. Significant
declines in prices could result in non-cash charges to earnings due to
impairment.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Since fourth quarter 2014, there has been a 
significant decline in oil and natural gas prices.&#160; </font>See <font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#8220;Results of Operations&#8221; under this Item 2. 
&#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and 
Results of Operations&#8221; of this Quarterly Report for more information on 
the average oil and natural gas prices received by the Fund during the three and
six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 and the effect of such decreased average
prices on the Fund&#8217;s results of operations.&#160; </font>If oil and 
natural gas prices continue to decline, even if only for a short period of time,
the Fund&#8217;s results of operations and liquidity will continue to be 
adversely impacted.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Market pricing for oil and natural gas, is volatile, and is 
likely to continue to be volatile in the future. This volatility is caused by 
numerous factors and market conditions that the Fund cannot control or 
influence. Therefore, it is impossible to predict the future price of oil and 
natural gas with any certainty. <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Factors affecting market pricing 
for oil and natural gas include:</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z49bcd0d052ac4894b5017a9a7c5b15b5" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">weather 
conditions;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:

<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',

conditions, including demand for petroleum-based products;</td>
</tr>

</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">actions by 
OPEC, the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z443d6bf56a094b76aec92fb9c21c49c8" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">political 
instability in the Middle East and other major oil and gas producing 
regions;</td>
</tr>

</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:

</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:

<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">domestic and
foreign tax policy;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Business Update</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Information regarding the Fund&#8217;s current projects, all of
which are located in the offshore waters of the Gulf of Mexico, is provided in 
the following table.&#160; See &#8220;Liquidity Needs&#8221; under this Item 2. 
<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt">&#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial 
Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; of this Quarterly Report for 
information regarding the funding of the Fund&#8217;s capital 
commitments.</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>

FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Diller Project is expected to include the development of 
two wells.&#160; Well #1 commenced production during third quarter 2015.&#160; 
Well #2 is expected to commence production in 2018.&#160;&#160;The well is 
currently shut-in due to a mechanical issue and is expected to remain shut-in 
until remediation plans can be finalized and implemented, which will likely take
one to three months.&#160; The Fund expects to spend $0.7 million for additional
development costs and $0.4 million for asset retirement obligations.</div>

%</div>
</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">$</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">5,624</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">$</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">9,235</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 32%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top" 
valign="bottom">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Marmalard Project is expected to include the development of
six wells.&#160; Wells #1, #2 and #3 commenced production during second quarter 
2015.&#160; Well #4 commenced production during fourth quarter 2015.&#160; 
Additional wells are expected to commence production in 2017 and 2020.&#160; The
Fund expects to spend $2.5 million for additional development costs and $1.1 
million for asset retirement obligations.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Results of Operations</div>

</div>

FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following table summarizes the Fund&#8217;s results of 
operations during the three and six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, and 
should be read in conjunction with the Fund&#8217;s financial statements and 
notes thereto included within Item 1.&#160; &#8220;Financial Statements&#8221; 
in Part I of this Quarterly Report.</div>
</div>

<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; 
WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">)</div>
</td>

ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">$</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(759</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; 
WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:

</td>

</table>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Overview.</font>&#160;
<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font>The following table provides information related to the
Fund&#8217;s oil and gas production and oil and gas revenue during the three and
six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015.&#160; Natural gas liquid 
(&#8220;NGL&#8221;) sales are included within gas sales.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>

id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">10</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">

<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">$</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">2.26</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">$</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">2.15</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">$</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">2.30</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The increases noted in the above table were primarily related 
to the commencement of production of the Marmalard and Diller projects.&#160; 
See additional discussion in &#8220;Business Update&#8221; section above.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Oil and Gas 
Revenue</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt">.&#160; The Fund generally sells oil, gas and NGLs </font>under two
types of agreements, which are common in the oil and gas industry. Both types of
agreements may include transportation charges. One type of agreement is a 
netback agreement, under which the Fund sells oil and gas at the wellhead and 
receives a price, net of transportation expense incurred by the purchaser. In 
this case, the Fund records revenue at the net price received from the 
purchaser. The second type of agreement is one whereby the Fund pays 
transportation expense directly. In that case, transportation expense is 
included within operating expense in the statements of operations.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Oil and gas revenue during the three months ended June 30, 2016
was $1.1 million, an increase of $0.8 million from the three months ended June 
30, 2015.&#160; The increase was attributable to increased sales volume totaling
$1.2 million, partially offset by decreased oil and gas prices totaling $0.4 
million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Oil and gas revenue during the six months ended June 30, 2016 
was $2.1 million, an increase of $1.7 million from the six months ended June 30,
2015.&#160; The increase was attributable to increased sales volume totaling 
$2.9 million, partially offset by decreased oil and gas prices totaling $1.2 
million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">See &#8220;Overview&#8221; above for factors that impact the 
oil and gas revenue volume and rate variances.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Depletion and 
Amortization</font>.&#160; Depletion and amortization during the three months 
ended June 30, 2016 was $0.5 million, an increase of $0.1 million from the three
months ended June 30, 2015.&#160; The increase was attributable to an increase 
in production volumes totaling $0.5 million, partially offset by adjustments to 
asset retirement obligations related to fully depleted properties totaling $0.3 
million, which were recorded in second quarter 2015, and a decrease in the 
average depletion rate totaling $0.1 million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Depletion and amortization during the six months ended June 30,
2016 was $1.2 million, an increase of $0.8 million from the six months ended 
June 30, 2015.&#160; The increase was attributable to an increase in production 
volumes totaling $1.2 million, partially offset by adjustments to asset 
retirement obligations totaling $0.3 million, which were recorded in second 
quarter 2015, and a decrease in the average depletion rate totaling $0.2 
million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The decreases in the average depletion rates were primarily 
attributable to the composite of the Fund&#8217;s productive wells.&#160; See 
&#8220;Overview&#8221; above for certain factors that impact the depletion and 
amortization volume and rate variances.&#160; Depletion and amortization rates 
may also be impacted by changes in reserve estimates provided annually by the 
Fund&#8217;s independent petroleum engineers.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Management Fees to 
Affiliate.&#160; </font>An annual management fee, totaling 1% of total capital 
contributions, net of cumulative dry-hole and related well costs incurred by the
Fund, is paid monthly to the Manager.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Operating 
Expenses.&#160; </font>Operating expenses represent <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">costs 
specifically identifiable or allocable to the Fund&#8217;s wells, as detailed in
the following table.</font></div>

<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR:
#cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

10pt">375</div>

<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">11</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" href="#TableofContents">Table of 
Contents</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Lease operating expense and transportation expense relates to 
the Fund&#8217;s producing properties.&#160; Insurance expense represents 
premiums related to the Fund&#8217;s properties, which vary depending upon the 
number of wells producing or drilling. Accretion expense related to the asset 
retirement obligations established for the Fund&#8217;s proved properties. 
Workover expense represents costs to restore or stimulate production of existing
reserves.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The average production cost, which includes lease operating 
expense, transportation expense and insurance expense, was $20.88 per barrel of 
oil equivalent (&#8220;BOE&#8221;) and $22.11 per BOE during the three and six 
months ended June 30, 2016, respectively, compared to $35.33 per BOE and $42.34 
per BOE during the three and six months ended June 30, 2015, respectively.&#160;
The decreases were primarily attributable to the change in the composite of the 
Fund&#8217;s producing wells coupled with the impact of the costs incurred by 
the Fund for wells that were no longer producing during the three and six months
ended June 30, 2015.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">General and Administrative Expenses.</font>&#160; General and 
administrative expenses represent costs specifically identifiable or allocable 
to the Fund, such as accounting and professional fees and insurance 
expenses.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Dividend 
Income.&#160;&#160;</font>Dividend income is related to the Fund&#8217;s 
investment in Delta House. See Note&#160;1 of &#8220;Notes to Unaudited 
Condensed Financial Statements&#8221; - &#8220;Organization and Summary of 
Significant Accounting Policies&#8221; contained in Item 1. &#8220;Financial 
Statements&#8221; within Part I of this Quarterly Report for more information 
regarding the Investment in Delta House.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Interest Income.</font>&#160;&#160; Interest income is 
comprised of interest earned on cash and cash equivalents and salvage 
fund.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Capital Resources and 
Liquidity</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Operating Cash 
Flows</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows provided by operating activities during the six 
months ended June 30, 2016 were $0.7 million, related to revenue received of 
$2.2 million and dividend income received of $0.1 million, partially offset by 
operating expenses of $1.4 million, management fees of $0.1 million, and general
and administrative expenses of $0.1 million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows used in operating activities during the six months 
ended June 30, 2015 were $0.2 million, related to operating expenses of $0.1 
million, management fees of $0.1 million and general and administrative expenses
of $0.1 million, partially offset by revenue received of $0.1 million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Investing Cash 
Flows</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows used in investing activities during the six months 
ended June 30, 2016 were $0.2 million, primarily related to investments in 
salvage fund.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows used in investing activities during the six months 
ended June 30, 2015 were $2.4 million, primarily related to capital expenditures
for oil and gas properties and investment in Delta House, inclusive of 
advances.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Financing Cash 
Flows</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows used in financing activities during the six months 
ended June 30, 2016 were $43 thousand related to manager and shareholder 
distributions.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There were no cash flows from financing activities during the 
six months ended June 30, 2015.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Estimated Capital Expenditures</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Capital 
Commitments</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund has entered into multiple agreements for the 
acquisition, drilling and development of its oil and gas properties. The 
estimated capital expenditures associated with these agreements vary depending 
on the stage of development on a property-by-property basis.&#160; See 
&#8220;Business Update&#8221; under this Item 2. <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition 
and Results of Operations&#8221; of this Quarterly Report for information 
regarding the Fund&#8217;s current projects.</font>&#160; See &#8220;Liquidity 
Needs&#8221; below for additional information.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Capital expenditures for oil and gas properties have been 
funded with the capital raised by the Fund in its private placement offering. 
The number of projects in which the Fund could invest was limited, and each 
unsuccessful project the Fund experienced exhausted its capital and reduced its 
ability to generate revenue.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">12</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" href="#TableofContents">Table of 
Contents</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Liquidity Needs</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund&#8217;s primary short-term liquidity needs are to fund
its operations and capital expenditures for its oil and gas properties.&#160; 
Such needs are funded utilizing operating income and existing cash on-
hand.&#160;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of June 30, 2016, the Fund&#8217;s estimated capital 
commitments related to its oil and gas properties were $5.8 million (which 
include asset retirement obligations for the Fund&#8217;s projects of $2.5 
million), of which $0.1 million is expected to be spent during the next twelve 
months. These expected capital commitments exceed available working capital and 
salvage fund by $3.3 million as of June 30, 2016.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based upon its current cash position and its current reserve 
estimates, the Fund expects cash flow from operations to be sufficient to cover 
its commitments as well as ongoing operations. Reserve estimates are projections
based on engineering data that cannot be measured with precision, require 
substantial judgment, and are subject to frequent revision.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Manager is entitled to receive an annual management fee 
from the Fund regardless of the Fund&#8217;s profitability in that year.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Distributions, if any, are funded from available cash from
operations, as defined in the LLC Agreement, and the frequency and amount are 
within the Manager&#8217;s discretion. Due to the significant capital required 
to develop the Diller and Marmalard projects, distributions have been impacted, 
and will be impacted in the future, by amounts reserved to provide for their 
ongoing development costs and funding their estimated asset retirement 
obligations.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Off-Balance Sheet 
Arrangements</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund had no off-balance sheet arrangements 
as of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015 and does not anticipate the use of 
such arrangements in the future.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Contractual 
Obligations</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund enters into participation and joint 
operating agreements with operators.&#160; On behalf of the Fund, an operator 
enters into various contractual commitments pertaining to exploration, 
development and production activities.&#160; The Fund does not negotiate such 
contracts.&#160; No contractual obligations exist as of June 30, 2016 and 
December 31, 2015 other than those discussed in &#8220;Estimated Capital 
Expenditures&#8221; above.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">See Note&#160;1 of &#8220;Notes to Unaudited Condensed 
Financial Statements&#8221; - &#8220;Organization and Summary of Significant 
Accounting Policies&#8221; contained in Item 1. &#8220;Financial 
Statements&#8221; within Part I of this Quarterly Report for a discussion of 
recent accounting pronouncements.<br>
 &#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">

cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',

</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Not required.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z37d3768f7e9e447298d40f1c8a2a773a" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 72pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right"><a 
name="p1ITEM4"><!--Anchor--></a>ITEM 4.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CONTROLS 
AND PROCEDURES</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In accordance with Rules 13a-15 and 15d-15 of the Securities 
Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;), the 
Fund&#8217;s management, including its Chief Executive Officer and Chief 
Financial Officer, evaluated the effectiveness of the Fund&#8217;s disclosure 
controls and procedures (as defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) under the 
Exchange Act) as of the end of the period covered by this report.&#160; Based on
that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer 
concluded that the Fund&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures were 
effective as of June 30, 2016.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There has been no change in the Fund&#8217;s internal control 
over financial reporting that occurred during the three months ended June 30, 
2016 that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect,
the Fund&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">13</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">PART II &#8211; OTHER INFORMATION</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a name="p2ITEM1.LEGALPROCEEDINGS"><!--
Anchor--></a>ITEM 1.&#160; LEGAL PROCEEDINGS</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">None.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">KATHLEEN P. MCSHERRY</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>

<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Name:</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.1
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<title></title>
<!--Licensed to: Securex
