<body style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
bgcolor="#ffffff" text="#000000">
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXHIBIT 31.1</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><u>CERTIFICATION</u></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Robert E. Swanson, certify that:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z5cf0f9eb0cd04bd7b51ac0c1a7cdeb30" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">1.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">I have reviewed this 
Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of Ridgewood Energy U Fund, LLC;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z2e36358c1882420da0781f5584787283" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">2.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">Based on my knowledge, this 
report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state
a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the 
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect
to the period covered by this report;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z2df19f479f7e485daafb731ee7684637" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">3.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">Based on my knowledge, the 
financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, 
fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of 
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods 
presented in this report;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z8eaafc48f3ab4141b00b8747d76806c4" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">4.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">The registrant&#8217;s other
certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining 
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) 
and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(f) and 15d &#8211; 15(f))&#160; for the 
registrant and have:</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a) Designed such disclosure controls and 
procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed 
under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the 
registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by 
others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this 
report is being prepared;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b) Designed such internal control over 
financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to
be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the
reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements 
for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting 
principles;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the 
registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this 
report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and 
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such 
evaluation; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d) Disclosed in this report any change in 
the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred 
during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s 
internal control over financial reporting; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zde1fb20cf9f1465a80a52354e22a93c5" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">5.</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: left">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I have 
disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over 
financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee 
of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the 
equivalent functions):</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a) All significant deficiencies and 
material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over 
financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the 
registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial 
information; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that
involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the 
registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="zd350c6d6dd9443d7b65fd82090be1a08" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dated:</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">August 9, 2016</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
top">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">/s/</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">ROBERT E. SWANSON</div>
</td>
<td style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Name:</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Robert E. Swanson</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Title:</div>
</td>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Chief Executive Officer</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
</tr>

<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXHIBIT 31.2</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><u>CERTIFICATION</u></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Kathleen P. McSherry, certify that:</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="ze129e512b4234fc1a3fb72e84b3562f9" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">1.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">I have reviewed this 
Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of Ridgewood Energy U Fund, LLC;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z45aef46453d5476c80b1b012e28bb476" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">2.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">Based on my knowledge, this 
report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state
a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the 
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect
to the period covered by this report;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zbf6cd4c776944c1a89998c7259c2d01d" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">3.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">Based on my knowledge, the 
financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, 
fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of 
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods 
presented in this report;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zbc417769660c42fea1560376e123e13e" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">4.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">The registrant&#8217;s other
certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining 
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) 
and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(f) and 15d &#8211; 15(f))&#160; for the 
registrant and have:</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a) Designed such disclosure controls and 
procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed 
under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the 
registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by 
others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this 
report is being prepared;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b) Designed such internal control over 
financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to
be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the
reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements 
for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting 
principles;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the 
registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this 
report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and 
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such 
evaluation; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d) Disclosed in this report any change in 
the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred 
during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s 
internal control over financial reporting; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z90f3c7808a49403298190ada7af157bc" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">5.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">The registrant&#8217;s other
certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation 
of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors
and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons
performing the equivalent functions):</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a) All significant deficiencies and 
material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over 
financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the 
registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial 
information; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that
involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the 
registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;

<div><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATIONS PURSUANT TO</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 
2002</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In connection with this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of the 
Ridgewood Energy U Fund, LLC (the &#8220;Fund&#8221;) for the period ended June 
30, 2016, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date 
hereof, (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), each of the undersigned officers of the Fund
hereby certifies, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. (section) 1350, as adopted pursuant to 
(section) 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that to the best of their 
knowledge:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">The Report fully complies 
with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act 
of 1934; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">

the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition

    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: bold 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;2.&amp;#160;&amp;#160; Related 
Parties&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Pursuant to the terms of the LLC Agreement, 
the Manager renders management, administrative and advisory services to the 
Fund.&amp;#160; For such services, the Manager is entitled to an annual 
management fee, payable monthly, of 2.5% of total capital contributions, net of 
cumulative dry-hole and related well costs incurred by the Fund.&amp;#160; 
During 2012, the Manager elected to reduce its management fee to 1% annually. 
&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Management fees during the three and six months ended June 
30, 2016 and 2015 were $66 thousand and $0.1 million, 
respectively.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Manager is entitled to receive a 15%
interest in cash distributions from operations made by the Fund. Distributions 
paid to the Manager during the six months ended June 30, 2016 were $7 thousand. 
The Fund did not pay distributions during the three months ended June 30, 2016 
and 2015 and during the six months ended June 30, 
2015.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;At times, short-term payables and receivables,
which do not bear interest, arise from transactions with affiliates in the 
ordinary course of business.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;None of the amounts paid to the Manager have 
been derived as a result of arm&amp;#8217;s length 
negotiations.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund has working interest ownership in 
certain projects to acquire and develop oil and natural gas projects with other 
entities that are likewise managed by the Manager.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="D2016-
01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: bold 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;3.&amp;#160;&amp;#160; Commitments and 
Contingencies&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Capital 
Commitments&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund has entered into multiple agreements 
for the acquisition, drilling and development of its oil and gas properties. The
estimated capital expenditures associated with these agreements vary depending 
on the stage of development on a property-by-property basis.&amp;#160; As of 
June 30, 2016, the Fund&amp;#8217;s estimated capital commitments related to its
oil and gas properties were $5.8 million (which include asset retirement 
obligations for the Fund&amp;#8217;s projects of $2.5 million), of which $0.1 
million is expected to be spent during the next twelve months.&amp;#160; These 
expected capital commitments exceed available working capital and salvage fund 
by $3.3 million at June 30, 2016.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Based upon its current cash position and its 
current reserve estimates, the Fund expects cash flow from operations to be 
sufficient to cover its commitments as well as ongoing operations. Reserve 
estimates are projections based on engineering data that cannot be measured with
precision, require substantial judgment, and are subject to frequent 
revision.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Environmental 
Considerations&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The exploration for and development of 
oil and natural gas involves the extraction, production and transportation of 
materials which, under certain conditions, can be hazardous or cause 
environmental pollution problems.&amp;#160; The Manager and operators of the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s properties are continually taking action they believe 
appropriate to satisfy applicable federal, state and local environmental 
regulations and do not currently anticipate that compliance with federal, state 
and local environmental regulations will have a material adverse effect upon 
capital expenditures, results of operations or the competitive position of the 
Fund in the oil and gas industry.&amp;#160; However, due to the significant 
public and governmental interest in environmental matters related to those 
activities, the Manager cannot predict the effects of possible future 
legislation, rule changes, or governmental or private claims.&amp;#160; As of 
June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, there were no known environmental 
contingencies that required adjustment to, or disclosure in, the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s financial statements.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;During the past several years, the United
States Congress, as well as certain regulatory agencies with jurisdiction over 
the Fund&amp;#8217;s business, have considered or proposed legislation or 
regulation relating to the upstream oil and gas industry both onshore and 
offshore.&amp;#160; If any such proposals were to be enacted or adopted they 
could potentially materially impact the Fund&amp;#8217;s operations.&amp;#160; 
It is not possible at this time to predict whether such legislation or 
regulation, if proposed, will be adopted as initially written, if at all, or how
legislation or new regulation that may be adopted would impact the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s business. Any such future laws and regulations could result in 
increased compliance costs or additional operating restrictions, which could 
have a material adverse effect on the Fund&amp;#8217;s operating results and 
cash flows.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Insurance 
Coverage&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund is subject to all risks inherent in 
the exploration for and development of oil and natural gas. Insurance coverage 
as is customary for entities engaged in similar operations is maintained, but 
losses may occur from uninsurable risks or amounts in excess of existing 
insurance coverage.&amp;#160; The occurrence of an event that is not insured or 
not fully insured could have a material adverse impact upon earnings and 
financial position.&amp;#160; Moreover, insurance is obtained as a package 
covering all of the funds managed by the Manager.&amp;#160; Claims made by other
funds managed by the Manager can reduce or eliminate insurance for the 
Fund.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;These unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements have been prepared by the Fund&amp;#8217;s management in accordance 
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
(&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) and in the opinion of management, contain all 
adjustments (consisting of only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to 
present fairly the Fund&amp;#8217;s financial position, results of operations 
and cash flows for the periods presented.&amp;#160; Certain information and note
disclosures normally included in annual financial statements prepared in 
accordance with GAAP have been omitted in these unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements.&amp;#160; The results of operations, financial position, 
and cash flows for the periods presented herein are not necessarily indicative 
of future financial results.&amp;#160; These unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements should be read in conjunction with the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
December 31, 2015 financial statements and notes thereto included in the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission (&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; The year-end 
condensed balance sheet data was derived from audited financial statements for 
the year ended December 31, 2015, but does not include all disclosures required 
by GAAP.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in 
accordance with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that 
affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of 
contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the reporting 
period.&amp;#160; On an ongoing basis, the Manager reviews its estimates, 
including those related to the fair value of financial instruments, net property
balances, determination of proved reserves, impairment of long-lived assets and 
asset retirement obligations. Actual results may differ from those 
estimates.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>
<us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The fair value 
measurement guidance provides a hierarchy that prioritizes and defines the types
of inputs used to measure fair value. The fair value hierarchy gives the highest
priority to Level 1 inputs, which consists of unadjusted quoted prices for 
identical instruments in active markets. Level 2 inputs consist of quoted prices
for similar instruments.&amp;#160; Level 3 inputs are unobservable inputs and 
include situations where there is little, if any, market activity for the 
instrument; hence, these inputs have the lowest 
priority.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif; color: #000000"&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;All 
highly liquid investments with maturities, when purchased, of three months or 
less, are considered cash equivalents. These balances, as well as cash on hand, 
are included in &amp;#8220;Cash and cash equivalents&amp;#8221; on the balance 
sheet. As of June 30, 2016, the Fund had no cash equivalents. At times, deposits
may be in excess of federally insured limits, which are $250 thousand per 
insured financial institution.&amp;#160; As of June 30, 2016, the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s bank balances were maintained in uninsured bank accounts at 
Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
    <cik1377178:SalvageFundPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Salvage Fund&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The 
Fund deposits in a separate interest-bearing account, or salvage fund, money to 
provide for the dismantling and removal of production platforms and facilities 
and plugging and abandoning its wells at the end of their useful lives in 
accordance with applicable federal and state laws and regulations.&amp;#160; 
Interest earned on the account will become part of the salvage fund. There are 
no restrictions on withdrawals from the salvage 
fund.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;</cik1377178:SalvageFundPolicyTextBlock>
    <cik1377178:InvestmentInEquipmentAndFacilitiesPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left;
font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Investment in Delta 
House&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund has investments in Delta House Oil and Gas 
Lateral, LLC and Delta House FPS, LLC (collectively &amp;#8220;Delta 
House&amp;#8221;), legal entities that own interests in a deepwater floating 
production system operated by LLOG Exploration Company.&amp;#160; The Fund 
accounts for its investment in Delta House using the cost method of accounting 
for investments as it does not have the ability to exercise significant 
influence over such investment.&amp;#160; Under the cost method, the Fund 
recognizes an investment in the equity of an investee at 
cost.&amp;#160;&amp;#160; The Fund recognizes&amp;#160;as income dividends 
received that are distributed from net accumulated earnings of the investee 
since the date of acquisition by the Fund.&amp;#160; Dividends received in 
excess of earnings subsequent to the date of investment are considered a return 
of investment and are recorded as reductions of cost of the 
investment.&amp;#160; The Fund reviews its cost method investment for impairment
at each reporting period and when an event or change in circumstances has 
occurred that may have a significant adverse effect on the fair value of the 
investment.&amp;#160; As of June 30, 2016, there are no such events or changes 
in circumstances that indicate that the Fund&amp;#8217;s investment in Delta 
House is 
impaired.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</cik1377178:InvestmentInEquipmentAndFacilities
PolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:FullCostOrSuccessfulEffortsPolicy contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-
06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: 
#000000"&gt;Oil and Gas Properties&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund invests in
oil and gas properties, which are operated by unaffiliated entities that are 
responsible for drilling, administering and producing activities pursuant to the
terms of the applicable operating agreements with working interest owners. The 
Fund&amp;#8217;s portion of exploration, drilling, operating and capital 
equipment expenditures is billed by 
operators.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Exploration, development and acquisition costs
are accounted for using the successful efforts method. Costs of acquiring 
unproved and proved oil and natural gas leasehold acreage, including lease 
bonuses, brokers&amp;#8217; fees and other related costs are capitalized. Costs 
of drilling and equipping productive wells and related production facilities are
capitalized.&amp;#160; The costs of exploratory wells are capitalized pending 
determination of whether proved reserves have been found. If proved commercial 
reserves are not found, exploratory well costs are expensed as dry-hole 
costs.&amp;#160; At times, the Fund receives adjustments to certain wells from 
their respective operators upon review and audit of the wells&amp;#8217; 
costs.&amp;#160; Annual lease rentals and exploration expenses are expensed as 
incurred.&amp;#160; All costs related to production activity, transportation 
expense and workover efforts are expensed as 
incurred.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Once a well has been determined to be fully 
depleted or upon the sale, retirement or abandonment of a property, the cost and
related accumulated depletion and amortization, if any, is eliminated from the 
property accounts, and the resultant gain or loss is 
recognized.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:FullCostOrSuccessfulEffortsPolicy>
    
<cik1377178:AdvancesToOperatorsForWorkingInterestsAndExpendituresPolicyTextBlock
contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Advances to 
Operators for Working Interests and Expenditures&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The 
Fund may be required to advance its share of the estimated succeeding 
month&amp;#8217;s expenditures to the operator for its oil and gas 
properties.&amp;#160; As the costs are incurred, the advances are reclassified 
to proved 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</cik1377178:AdvancesToOperatorsForWorkingInt
erestsAndExpendituresPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:AssetRetirementObligationsPolicy contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-
06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Asset Retirement 
Obligations&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;For oil and gas properties, there are 
obligations to perform removal and remediation activities when the properties 
are retired.&amp;#160; Upon the determination of a property to be either proved 
or dry, a retirement obligation is incurred.&amp;#160; The Fund recognizes the 
fair value of a liability for an asset retirement obligation in the period 
incurred. Plug and abandonment costs associated with unsuccessful projects are 
expensed as dry-hole costs.&amp;#160; As indicated above, the Fund maintains a 
salvage fund to provide for the funding of asset retirement 
obligations.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:AssetRetirementObligationsPolicy>
    <cik1377178:SyndicationCostsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-
06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: 
#000000"&gt;Syndication Costs&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Syndication costs are 
direct costs incurred by the Fund in connection with the offering of the
Fund&amp;#8217;s shares, including professional fees, selling expenses and 
administrative costs payable to the Manager, an affiliate of the Manager and 
unaffiliated broker-dealers, which are reflected on the Fund&amp;#8217;s balance
sheet as a reduction of shareholders&amp;#8217; 
capital.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;</cik1377178:SyndicationCostsPolicyTex
tBlock>
    <us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-
06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Revenue Recognition 
and&amp;#160;Imbalances&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify;
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Oil and gas revenues are recognized
when oil and gas is sold to a purchaser at a fixed or determinable price, when 
delivery has occurred and title has transferred, and collectability of the 
revenue is reasonably assured.&lt;font style="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt; The Fund uses the sales method of 
accounting for gas production imbalances.&amp;#160; The volumes of gas sold may 
differ from the volumes to which the Fund is entitled based on its interests in 
the properties.&amp;#160; These differences create imbalances that are 
recognized as a liability only when the properties&amp;#8217; estimated 
remaining reserves net to the Fund will not be sufficient to enable the 
underproduced owner to recoup its entitled share through production.&amp;#160; 
The Fund&amp;#8217;s recorded liability, if any, would be reflected in other 
liabilities.&amp;#160; No receivables are recorded for those wells where the 
Fund has taken less than its share of production.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: 
#000000"&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The 
Fund reviews the carrying value of its oil and gas properties annually and when 
management determines that events and circumstances indicate that the recorded 
carrying value of properties may not be recoverable.&amp;#160; Impairments are 
determined by comparing estimated future net undiscounted cash flows to the 
carrying value at the time of the review.&amp;#160; If the carrying value 
exceeds the estimated future net undiscounted cash flows, the carrying value of 
the asset is written down to fair value, which is determined using estimated 
future net discounted cash flows from the asset.&amp;#160; The fair value 
determinations require considerable judgment and are sensitive to 
change.&amp;#160; Different pricing assumptions, reserve estimates or discount 
rates could result in a different calculated impairment.&amp;#160; Given the 
volatility of oil and natural gas prices, it is reasonably possible that the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s estimate of discounted future net cash flows from proved oil 
and natural gas reserves could change in the near 
term.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Significant declines in oil and natural gas 
prices since fourth quarter 2014 have impacted the fair value of the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s oil and gas properties.&amp;#160; If oil and natural gas prices
continue to decline, even if only for a short period of time, it is possible 
that impairments of oil and gas properties will 
occur.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and 
Amortization&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and amortization of the cost of 
proved oil and gas properties are calculated using the units-of-production 
method.&amp;#160; Proved developed reserves are used as the base for depleting 
capitalized costs associated with successful exploratory well costs, development
costs and related facilities.&amp;#160; The sum of proved developed and proved 
undeveloped reserves is used as the base for depleting or amortizing leasehold
acquisition costs.&amp;#160; During the three and six months ended June 30, 
2015, the Fund recorded $0.3 million of depletion expense related to adjustments
to asset retirement obligations for fully depleted 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left;
font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Income 
Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;No provision is made for income taxes in the 
financial statements.&amp;#160; The Fund is a limited liability company, and as 
such, the Fund&amp;#8217;s income or loss is passed through and included in the 
tax returns of the Fund&amp;#8217;s shareholders. The Fund files U.S. Federal 
and State tax returns and the 2013 through 2015 tax returns remain open for 
examination by tax authorities.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <cik1377178:IncomeAndExpenseAllocationPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-
01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: left; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Income and Expense Allocation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Profits
and losses are allocated to shareholders and the Manager in accordance with the 
LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</cik1377178:IncomeAndExpenseAllocationPolicyT
extBlock>
    <cik1377178:DistributionsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Distributions&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify;
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Distributions to shareholders are 
allocated in proportion to the number of shares held. The Manager determines 
whether available cash from operations, as defined in the LLC Agreement, will be
distributed.&amp;#160; Such distributions are allocated 85% to the shareholders 
and 15% to the Manager, as required by the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Available cash from dispositions, as defined 
in the LLC Agreement, will be paid 99% to shareholders and 1% to the Manager 
until the shareholders have received total distributions equal to their capital 
contributions.&amp;#160; After shareholders have received distributions equal to
their capital contributions, 85% of available cash from dispositions will be 
distributed to shareholders and 15% to the 
Manager.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</cik1377178:DistributionsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="D2016-
01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Recent Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In January 2016, the Financial Accounting
Standards Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) issued accounting guidance that 
requires, among other things, companies to measure investments in other 
entities, except those accounted for under the equity method, at fair value and 
recognize any changes in fair value in net income unless an election is made to 
record the investment at cost, less impairment and plus or minus subsequent 
adjustments for observable price changes with change in basis reported in 
current earnings. This pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning 
after December 15, 2017 and interim periods within those fiscal years, with 
early adoption not permitted. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of 
this guidance on its financial 
statements.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In 2014, the FASB issued accounting guidance 
on revenue recognition, which provides for a single five-step model to be 
applied to all revenue contracts with customers. In 2015, the FASB issued a 
deferral of the effective date of the guidance to 2018, with early adoption
permitted in 2017. In May 2016, the FASB issued final amendments which provided 
narrow scope improvements and practical expedients related to the implementation
of the guidance. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance on
its financial statements.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-
gaap:OrganizationConsolidationBasisOfPresentationBusinessDescriptionAndAccountin
gPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-
30">&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;1.
Organization and Summary of Significant Accounting 
Policies&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: 
#000000"&gt;Organization&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Ridgewood Energy U 
Fund, LLC (the &amp;#8220;Fund&amp;#8221;), a Delaware limited liability 
company, was formed on August 28, 2006 and operates pursuant to a limited 
liability company agreement (the &amp;#8220;LLC Agreement&amp;#8221;) dated as 
of October 1, 2006 by and among Ridgewood Energy Corporation (the 
&amp;#8220;Manager&amp;#8221;) and the shareholders of the Fund, which addresses
matters such as the authority and voting rights of the Manager and shareholders,
capitalization, transferability of membership interests, participation in costs 
and revenues, distribution of assets and dissolution and winding up. The Fund 
was organized to primarily acquire interests in oil and gas properties located 
in the United States offshore waters of Texas, Louisiana and Alabama in the Gulf
of Mexico.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;The Manager has direct and&lt;/font&gt; 
exclusive control over the management of the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
operations.&amp;#160; With respect to project investments, the Manager locates 
potential projects, conducts due diligence, and negotiates and completes the 
transactions.&amp;#160; The Manager performs, or arranges for the performance 
of, the management, advisory and administrative services required for Fund 
operations.&amp;#160; Such services include, without limitation, the 
administration of shareholder accounts, shareholder relations and the 
preparation, review and dissemination of tax and other financial 
information.&amp;#160; In addition, the Manager provides office space, equipment
and facilities and other services necessary for Fund operations.&amp;#160; The 
Manager also engages and manages the contractual relations with unaffiliated 
custodians, depositories, accountants, attorneys, broker-dealers, corporate 
fiduciaries, insurers, banks and others as required.&amp;#160; See Notes 2 and 
3.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;These unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements have been prepared by the Fund&amp;#8217;s management in accordance 
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
(&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) and in the opinion of management, contain all 
adjustments (consisting of only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to 
present fairly the Fund&amp;#8217;s financial position, results of operations 
and cash flows for the periods presented.&amp;#160; Certain information and note
disclosures normally included in annual financial statements prepared in 
accordance with GAAP have been omitted in these unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements.&amp;#160; The results of operations, financial position, 
and cash flows for the periods presented herein are not necessarily indicative 
of future financial results.&amp;#160; These unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements should be read in conjunction with the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
December 31, 2015 financial statements and notes thereto included in the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission (&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; The year-end 
condensed balance sheet data was derived from audited financial statements for
the year ended December 31, 2015, but does not include all disclosures required 
by GAAP.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in 
accordance with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that 
affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of 
contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the reporting 
period.&amp;#160; On an ongoing basis, the Manager reviews its estimates, 
including those related to the fair value of financial instruments, net property
balances, determination of proved reserves, impairment of long-lived assets and 
asset retirement obligations. Actual results may differ from those 
estimates.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Fair Value 
Measurements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The fair value measurement guidance provides a
hierarchy that prioritizes and defines the types of inputs used to measure fair 
value. The fair value hierarchy gives the highest priority to Level 1 inputs, 
which consists of unadjusted quoted prices for identical instruments in active 
markets. Level 2 inputs consist of quoted prices for similar 
instruments.&amp;#160; Level 3 inputs are unobservable inputs and include 
situations where there is little, if any, market activity for the instrument; 
hence, these inputs have the lowest 
priority.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Cash and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;All highly liquid investments with maturities,
when purchased, of three months or less, are considered cash equivalents. These 
balances, as well as cash on hand, are included in &amp;#8220;Cash and cash 
equivalents&amp;#8221; on the balance sheet. As of June 30, 2016, the Fund had 
no cash equivalents. At times, deposits may be in excess of federally insured 
limits, which are $250 thousand per insured financial institution.&amp;#160; As 
of June 30, 2016, the Fund&amp;#8217;s bank balances were maintained in 
uninsured bank accounts at Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Salvage 
Fund&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund deposits in a separate interest-bearing 
account, or salvage fund, money to provide for the dismantling and removal of 
production platforms and facilities and plugging and abandoning its wells at the
end of their useful lives in accordance with applicable federal and state laws 
and regulations.&amp;#160; Interest earned on the account will become part of 
the salvage fund. There are no restrictions on withdrawals from the salvage 
fund.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Investment in Delta 
House&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund has investments in Delta House Oil and Gas 
Lateral, LLC and Delta House FPS, LLC (collectively &amp;#8220;Delta 
House&amp;#8221;), legal entities that own interests in a deepwater floating 
production system operated by LLOG Exploration Company.&amp;#160; The Fund 
accounts for its investment in Delta House using the cost method of accounting 
for investments as it does not have the ability to exercise significant 
influence over such investment.&amp;#160; Under the cost method, the Fund 
recognizes an investment in the equity of an investee at 
cost.&amp;#160;&amp;#160; The Fund recognizes&amp;#160;as income dividends 
received that are distributed from net accumulated earnings of the investee 
since the date of acquisition by the Fund.&amp;#160; Dividends received in 
excess of earnings subsequent to the date of investment are considered a return
of investment and are recorded as reductions of cost of the 
investment.&amp;#160; The Fund reviews its cost method investment for impairment
at each reporting period and when an event or change in circumstances has 
occurred that may have a significant adverse effect on the fair value of the 
investment.&amp;#160; As of June 30, 2016, there are no such events or changes 
in circumstances that indicate that the Fund&amp;#8217;s investment in Delta 
House is impaired.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Oil and Gas 
Properties&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund invests in oil and gas properties, 
which are operated by unaffiliated entities that are responsible for drilling, 
administering and producing activities
 pursuant to the terms of the applicable operating agreements with working 
interest owners. The Fund&amp;#8217;s portion of exploration, drilling, 
operating and capital equipment expenditures is billed by 
operators.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Exploration, development and acquisition costs
are accounted for using the successful efforts method. Costs of acquiring 
unproved and proved oil and natural gas leasehold acreage, including lease 
bonuses, brokers&amp;#8217; fees and other related costs are capitalized. Costs 
of drilling and equipping productive wells and related production facilities are
capitalized.&amp;#160; The costs of exploratory wells are capitalized pending 
determination of whether proved reserves have been found. If proved commercial 
reserves are not found, exploratory well costs are expensed as dry-hole 
costs.&amp;#160; At times, the Fund receives adjustments to certain wells from 
their respective operators upon review and audit of the wells&amp;#8217; 
costs.&amp;#160; Annual lease rentals and exploration expenses are expensed as 
incurred.&amp;#160; All costs related to production activity, transportation 
expense and workover efforts are expensed as 
incurred.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Once a well has been determined to be fully 
depleted or upon the sale, retirement or abandonment of a property, the cost and
related accumulated depletion and amortization, if any, is eliminated from the 
property accounts, and the resultant gain or loss is 
recognized.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Advances to Operators for Working 
Interests and Expenditures&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund may be required 
to advance its share of the estimated succeeding month&amp;#8217;s expenditures 
to the operator for its oil and gas properties.&amp;#160; As the costs are 
incurred, the advances are reclassified to proved 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Asset Retirement 
Obligations&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;For oil and gas properties, there are 
obligations to perform removal and remediation activities when the properties 
are retired.&amp;#160; Upon the determination of a property to be either proved 
or dry, a retirement obligation is incurred.&amp;#160; The Fund recognizes the 
fair value of a liability for an asset retirement obligation in the period 
incurred. Plug and abandonment costs associated with unsuccessful projects are 
expensed as dry-hole costs.&amp;#160; As indicated above, the Fund maintains a 
salvage fund to provide for the funding of asset retirement 
obligations.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Syndication 
Costs&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Syndication costs are direct costs incurred by the 
Fund in connection with the offering of the Fund&amp;#8217;s shares, including 
professional fees, selling expenses and administrative costs payable to the
Manager, an affiliate of the Manager and unaffiliated broker-dealers, which are 
reflected on the Fund&amp;#8217;s balance sheet as a reduction of 
shareholders&amp;#8217; capital.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: #000000"&gt;Revenue Recognition 
and&amp;#160;Imbalances&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify;
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Oil and gas revenues are recognized
when oil and gas is sold to a purchaser at a fixed or determinable price, when 
delivery has occurred and title has transferred, and collectability of the 
revenue is reasonably assured.&lt;font style="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt; The Fund uses the sales method of 
accounting for gas production imbalances.&amp;#160; The volumes of gas sold may 
differ from the volumes to which the Fund is entitled based on its interests in 
the properties.&amp;#160; These differences create imbalances that are 
recognized as a liability only when the properties&amp;#8217; estimated 
remaining reserves net to the Fund will not be sufficient to enable the 
underproduced owner to recoup its entitled share through production.&amp;#160; 
The Fund&amp;#8217;s recorded liability, if any, would be reflected in other 
liabilities.&amp;#160; No receivables are recorded for those wells where the 
Fund has taken less than its share of production.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; color: 
#000000"&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The 
Fund reviews the carrying value of its oil and gas properties annually and when 
management determines that events and circumstances indicate that the recorded 
carrying value of properties may not be recoverable.&amp;#160; Impairments are 
determined by comparing estimated future net undiscounted cash flows to the 
carrying value at the time of the review.&amp;#160; If the carrying value 
exceeds the estimated future net undiscounted cash flows, the carrying value of 
the asset is written down to fair value, which is determined using estimated 
future net discounted cash flows from the asset.&amp;#160; The fair value 
determinations require considerable judgment and are sensitive to 
change.&amp;#160; Different pricing assumptions, reserve estimates or discount 
rates could result in a different calculated impairment.&amp;#160; Given the 
volatility of oil and natural gas prices, it is reasonably possible that the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s estimate of discounted future net cash flows from proved oil 
and natural gas reserves could change in the near 
term.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Significant declines in oil and natural gas 
prices since fourth quarter 2014 have impacted the fair value of the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s oil and gas properties.&amp;#160; If oil and natural gas prices
continue to decline, even if only for a short period of time, it is possible 
that impairments of oil and gas properties will 
occur.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and 
Amortization&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and amortization of the cost of 
proved oil and gas properties are calculated using the units-of-production 
method.&amp;#160; Proved developed reserves are used as the base for depleting 
capitalized costs associated with successful exploratory well costs, development
costs and related facilities.&amp;#160; The sum of proved developed and proved 
undeveloped reserves is used as the base for depleting or amortizing leasehold 
acquisition costs.&amp;#160; During the three and six months ended June 30, 
2015, the Fund recorded $0.3 million of depletion expense related to adjustments
to asset retirement obligations for fully depleted 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Income 
Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;No provision is made for income taxes in the
financial statements.&amp;#160; The Fund is a limited liability company, and as 
such, the Fund&amp;#8217;s income or loss is passed through and included in the 
tax returns of the Fund&amp;#8217;s shareholders. The Fund files U.S. Federal 
and State tax returns and the 2013 through 2015 tax returns remain open for 
examination by tax authorities.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Income and Expense 
Allocation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Profits and losses are allocated to 
shareholders and the Manager in accordance with the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Distributions&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify;
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Distributions to shareholders are 
allocated in proportion to the number of shares held. The Manager determines 
whether available cash from operations, as defined in the LLC Agreement, will be
distributed.&amp;#160; Such distributions are allocated 85% to the shareholders 
and 15% to the Manager, as required by the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times
 New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Available cash from dispositions, as defined in the
LLC Agreement, will be paid 99% to shareholders and 1% to the Manager until the 
shareholders have received total distributions equal to their capital 
contributions.&amp;#160; After shareholders have received distributions equal to
their capital contributions, 85% of available cash from dispositions will be 
distributed to shareholders and 15% to the 
Manager.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Recent Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In January 2016, the Financial Accounting
Standards Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) issued accounting guidance that 
requires, among other things, companies to measure investments in other 
entities, except those accounted for under the equity method, at fair value and 
recognize any changes in fair value in net income unless an election is made to 
record the investment at cost, less impairment and plus or minus subsequent 
adjustments for observable price changes with change in basis reported in 
current earnings. This pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning 
after December 15, 2017 and interim periods within those fiscal years, with 
early adoption not permitted. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of 
this guidance on its financial 
statements.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In 2014, the FASB issued accounting guidance 
on revenue recognition, which provides for a single five-step model to be 
applied to all revenue contracts with customers. In 2015, the FASB issued a 
deferral of the effective date of the guidance to 2018, with early adoption 
permitted in 2017. In May 2016, the FASB issued final amendments which provided 
narrow scope improvements and practical expedients related to the implementation
of the guidance. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance on
its financial statements.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:OrganizationConsolidationBasisOfPresentationBusinessDescriptionAndAccountin
gPoliciesTextBlock>
</xbrli:xbrl>
</XBRL>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

    <element 
id="cik1377178_LongTermPurchaseCommitmentAmountInExcessOfWorkingCapital"

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccountsPayableCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities
incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to 
vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business. 
Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or 
within the normal operating cycle if longer).</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.19(a))<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br></p></div>

<tr>
<td><strong> Period Type:</strong></td>
<td>instant</td>
</tr>
</table></div>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccountsReceivableNetCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount due from customers or clients, within one year of 
the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), for
goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold
in the normal course of business, reduced to the estimated net realizable fair 
value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain
of collection.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02(3))<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-
02(4))<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br></p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccruedLiabilitiesCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations
incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are 
incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which 
invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include 
taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used to reflect the current portion of the 
liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if 
longer).</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AssetRetirementObligationCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Current portion of the carrying amount of a liability for 
an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal 
obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived 
asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the 
normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of 
lessees.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly 
liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash 
and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in 
value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CommitmentsAndContingencies">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Represents the caption on the face of the balance sheet to
indicate that the entity has entered into (1) purchase or supply arrangements 
that will require expending a portion of its resources to meet the terms 
thereof, and (2) is exposed to potential losses or, less frequently, gains, 
arising from (a) possible claims against a company's resources due to future 
performance under contract terms, and (b) possible losses or likely gains from 
uncertainties that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events 
that are deemed likely to occur do occur or fail to occur.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all liabilities that are recognized. Liabilities are probable future 
sacrifices of economic benefits arising from present obligations of an entity to
transfer assets or provide services to other entities in the future.</p></div>

amortization of oil and gas property carried under the successful effort method.
Oil and gas property include, but not limited to, the entity's wells and related
equipment and facilities.</p></div>
